alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 26 at 7:40AM MST until November 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches at Lookout Pass is possible, 2 to 4 inches east of St. Regis. Snow rates between 6 am MST and noon could exceed 0.50" per hour. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...From late tonight through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
